resources.string:
ecoBee provides a rather baroque process for validating that an application is allowed to access the data from your intelligent thermostat. As it turns out, the easiest way to do this is to utilize the ecoBee web portal. This popup will try to make that process as easy as possible for you.

Note that the portal promotes a slight misconception. It talks about creating a new app and authorizing that app. Calling this an app is actually a misnomer. Rather than creating a new app what we are really doing is authorizing this app to access your data.

Anyway, once you press the Start button on this page the authorizion process can proceed as follows:

- Pressing the Start button will spawn a browser that goes to the ecoBee web portal.

- Login to the portal with your ecobee account info (create a new account if you don"t have one).

- Follow the instructions on the Developer section to create a new app.

- The new app page will create a new API Key.

- Copy that API key to the Android clip board so you can paste it into the AtHome app.

- Swith back to the AtHome app and paste the API key into the ecoBee popup (you could manually type the key in but it"s long, random, and mistake prone - cut/paste is a lot easier).

- Press the CREATE PIN button. This will display a new popup window that shows a 4 character PIN. Remember these 4 characters for the next step.

- Switch back to the browser and go to the My Apps section.

- Select the application you created and press the Add Application button.

- In the new window enter the 4 digit PIN that you got earlier and select the Validate button.

- The window will change and you can finally select the Add Application button that replaced the Validate button. (Having a new button appear in the same place as an old button is a terrible UI choice, especially when that new button re-uses a prior label but hey, talk to ecoBee about that).

- Switch back to the AtHome app and now press the VALIDATED PIN button.

- All done.

The AtHome app will now finish the authorization process and it should be able to access your thermostat data.
